author: Zubeda Hamid
text:
After four days of protesting this month, organisations working for disability rights called off their agitation on Saturday afternoon and welcomed the Chief Minister’s announcement that met some of the demands they had struggled for.

“We welcome the move to extend financial assistance to those with 40 per cent and above disabilities. The removal of the ‘destitute’ clause and the setting up of a committee to monitor the implementation of welfare schemes are moves in the right direction,” said S. Nambu Rajan, State general secretary, Tamil Nadu Association for the Rights of All Types of Differently Abled & Caregivers.

On setting up of a State coordination committee headed by Social Welfare Minister, Smitha Sadasivan, member of the Disability Rights Alliance, Tamil Nadu, questioned what had happened to the State coordination committee for so long.

“The committee had earlier been set up but has not been functioning for several years. Why has the government not been transparent about the committee and its procedures so far,” she asked.
title: Activists call off stir, welcome announcement
